titles.title: Occupational Safety and Health Independent Review of OSHA Citations Act of 2005
Occupational Safety and Health Independent Review of OSHA Citations Act of 2005
Occupational Safety and Health Independent Review of OSHA Citations Act of 2005

To amend the Occupational Safety and Health Act of 1970 to provide for judicial deference to conclusions of law determined by the Occupational Safety and Health Review Commission with respect to an order issued by the Commission.

bill.summary: 7/12/2005--Passed House amended. Occupational Safety and Health Independent Review of OSHA Citations Act of 2005 - Amends the Occupational Safety and Health Act of 1970 (OSH Act) to revise requirements for judicial review of orders by the Occupational Safety and Health Review Commission (OSHRC), which is the agency for independent review of citations issued by the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) against businesses for violations of the OSH Act. Requires deference to be given to reasonable conclusions of OSHRC (rather than OSHA) with respect to all questions of law that are subject to agency deference under governing court precedent.
